meanings.definition: To establish or introduce (something, such as a law or system)
meanings.sent1: The school is instituting a new dress code policy.
meanings.sent2: The government is instituting a new tax law next month.
meanings.sent3: The penguins are instituting a 'no swimming' rule in the fish tank.
meanings.sent4: The CEO is instituting a culture of transparency in the company.
meanings.sent5: Instituting a daily exercise routine can improve your health.

meanings.definition: To set in motion or put into operation
meanings.sent1: The manager is instituting a new project management system.
meanings.sent2: The team is instituting a plan to increase productivity.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels are instituting a 'no nut left behind' policy.
meanings.sent4: The conductor is instituting a new schedule for the trains.
meanings.sent5: Instituting a morning routine can help you start your day right.
